quote.text: Judge not, that ye be not judged.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye; and, behold, a beam is in thine own eye?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Thou hypocrite, first cast out the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother's eye.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Or what man is there of you, whom if his son ask bread, will he give him a stone?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Enter ye in at the strait gate: for wide is the gate, and broad is the way, that leadeth to destruction, and many there be which go in thereat:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Because strait is the gate, and narrow is the way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name? and in thy name have cast out devils? and in thy name done many wonderful works?
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, which built his house upon a rock:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not: for it was founded upon a rock.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them not, shall be likened unto a foolish man, which built his house upon the sand:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell: and great was the fall of it.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these sayings, the people were astonished at his doctrine:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: For he taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
quote.author: Matthew
